notes: Airbnb decides when 2FA is required; user cannot enable 2FA for every login.

Email 2FA is always available as a backup.
2FA options other than email and TOTP are only available on paid plans
Setup requires SMS verification. Email is available via 'other options' at login.
2FA can only be enabled via the website.
2FA must be enabled by a site administrator before use.
Email 2FA is always enabled.
Email is always enabled as backup method for Software Token.
You can only have one 2FA option enabled at a time.
2FA is only available for commercial partners.
SMS or email must be set up as a backup method
Email 2FA is mandatory for all users but only requested for unknown devices
SMS or email must be set up as a backup method
2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions
2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions
2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions
2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions
Receiving codes via SMS cost 0.05$ each message. 2FA is personalizable in account settings.
TOTP 2FA only available after enabling SMS or phone 2FA.
Applies to IdentityIQ and IdentityNow.
Only account owners and co-account owners can enable 2FA.
Email method requires an additional PIN
Must be associated with a Microsoft Account.
Email and SMS 2FA can only be enabled as backup methods.
A phone number is required as a fallback for Steam Mobile 2FA.
Requires enabling at least two 2FA methods.
2FA is only available with a verified email address
SMS and TOTP 2FA require adding a phone number as a fallback. SMS 2FA is not available in all regions.
2FA is only available for instructor accounts
SMS 2FA is only available for US and Canada phone numbers.
Only one of the 2FA methods can be enabled at the same time.
